RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 77. Maiden Claiming Purse 47000. (UP TO $8,178 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TALKIN PHAROAH was hustled to the front then moved in while going clear, came under light coaxing in the two path passing the seven-sixteenths, controlled the action off the rail through the turn, extended the advantage with ease into upper stretch, drew off under a very mild hand ride into the final furlong and widened to win as the rider pleased. FRISKY JIM was off slow and spotted the front couple lengths, angled out under urging outside the five-eighths, moved closer late on the backstretch, chased in the four path going around the turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and safely secured the place. HAPPY BOB broke a half-step slow then dropped back, was urged along towards the rear, moved from three to five wide going around the turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and lacked the needed response while best of the rest. AL'S FROSTED tracked the leader down the backstretch, chased in the three path for most of the turn then dropped to the two path and tired. SHAKIN THE BELLE broke a half-step slow, settled on the outside, was caught five wide early on the turn then dropped to the four path, moved to the two path coming to the seven-sixteenths, spun three wide into the stretch, was guided in behind a foe outside the furlong marker then ducked in and was no factor. OBSCURED BY CLOUDS broke a bit awkwardly but in the front half of the field then was hustled, established a good position just off the pace, tossed his head while lugging out briefly into the turn, saved ground while asked on that bend, turned into the stretch in the two path and had nothing left.

ENTRY.NAME: Obscured by Clouds
ENTRY.OWNER: Potash Edward C Labin Scot and Ryerson James T
ENTRY.COMMENT: bit awkwrd brk,hustld,toss head 4-1/2,lug out brief,ins trn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Frisky Jim
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow,angled out 5/8,closer1/2,4p turn,chased,clear for place

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Bob
ENTRY.OWNER: Sal-Lou J G Stable Rosenthal Robert D Rosenthal Peter and Greenberg Martin
ENTRY.COMMENT: off 1/2 step slow,drop back,3-5w turn,lacked needed response

ENTRY.NAME: Shakin the Belle
ENTRY.OWNER: MC Stables and Rodriguez Rudy R
ENTRY.COMMENT: off1/2step slw,settld outside,5w1/2,2p7/16,3p1/4,duck in,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Talkin Pharoah
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,clear,2path turn,drew off,very mild hand ride,handily

ENTRY.NAME: Al's Frosted
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace,chased 3path turn,2path outside 1/4,tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 2 1 1/8M Inner turf CR: 101. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 100000. INNER TURF (UP TO $17,400 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 1 20 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Since November 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At T ime Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PORTFOLIO COMPANY pulled keenly under restraint three then two wide through the first turn first pulling briefly in tandem with DRIPPING GOLD, then hooking up with NIGHT JUMPER as that rival pulled eagerly into the backstretch, eased off to tuck to the inside tracking the leader in closest aim behind loose cover, tipped to the two path half a mile from home nudging DRIPPING GOLD three wide through the far turn, advanced on the leader between foes coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, swung four wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command just outside the eighth pole, dug in gamely to hold safe to the finish kept to task. DAUNT coaxed from the gate, tracked the pace along the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun three wide for home and ran on willingly to the finish to secure the place honors. DRIPPING GOLD grew keen briefly twice through the first turn before being successfully eased off of PORTFOLIO COMPANY midway on the turn, chased just off the inside until nudged three wide by that same rival half a mile out, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch and ran on to procure the show honors. SPACE LAUNCH tracked the front just off the inside early on until tipped three then four wide through the far turn getting placed to coaxing three furlongs out, angled six wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild bid. Q F SEVENTY FIVE coaxed from the start, tracked the pace along the inside under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, angled four to five wide into upper stretch and weakened in the late stages. NIGHT JUMPER established the front and showed the way into the first turn, had PORTFOLIO COMPANY advance keenly outside seven and a half furlongs from home and was inspired to pull eagerly on his bit briefly running off as a pair from the rest of the field before settling back down with seven furlongs to run, showed the way in hand along the inside, came under coaxing near the five-sixteenths under challenge, took the inside route into upper stretch clinging to command, yielded nearing the eighth pole and weakened in the late going.

ENTRY.NAME: Dripping Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: West Point Thoroughbreds NBS Stable and Titletown Racing Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: briefly keen 2x 1st trn, 2-3w pursuit, 5w upper, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Q F Seventy Five
ENTRY.OWNER: West Point Thoroughbreds and NBS Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, tracked ins, coaxed 5/16, angled 4-5w upper, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Daunt
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, tracked inside, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Night Jumper
ENTRY.COMMENT: pulled eager 7 1/2, in hand ins, ins 1/4, collared, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Portfolio Company
ENTRY.COMMENT: pulled keen 3w 1st trn, tracked ins, 4w upper, up, dug in, game

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Kenneth L. Ramsey & Sarah K. Ramsey

ENTRY.NAME: Space Launch
ENTRY.OWNER: Athlone Racing Oakwood Stables (Daniel J Burke) and Burke Jane
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p, coaxed 3-4w 3/8, angled 6w upper, mild bid

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 3 1M Turf CR: 79. Maiden Claiming Purse 55000. (UP TO $9,570 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $75,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to r un this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the Main Track.) (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BROKEN SPUR broke out and forced foes out but was away fast, showed the way while well rated on the inside, responded well when set down into upper stretch, came under a right-handed crop outside the furlong marker and held determinedly under steady urging. MR FLOWERS bumped lightly with a foe while forced out some just after the start, was well placed down the backstretch, angled from the rail to the three path while roused near the three-eighths, chased the winner under a drive in the stretch, came out inside the sixteenth-pole and finished willingly for the place. VARIABLE COST (GB) was forced out at the start and taken up, raced at the rear under reserve, was taken up off heels near the half-mile pole, advanced inside while roused on the turn, chased into upper stretch and lacked the needed kick while best of the rest. FIRE BARON broke out at the start, settled comfortably off the pace, was roused in the two path on the turn and lacked the needed response. GOLDEN PURCHASE made light contact with a foe shortly after the start, stalked the pace on the outside, was asked while moving from the two path to the four path on the turn and came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Broken Spur
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,away fast,well rated,ins turn,ask1/4,responded,held

ENTRY.NAME: Variable Cost (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced out brk,tkn up,reserved,tkn up 1/2,ins turn,chsd,best rest

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Flowers
ENTRY.OWNER: Dubb Michael Louis Lazzinnaro LLC and Flower Power Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: light bump brk,well placed,angled ins-3w trn,gained,chsd,willing

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Purchase
ENTRY.COMMENT: light bump brk,stalked outside,ask 2-4path turn,came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Fire Baron
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,settled,roused 2path turn,no response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 95000. (UP TO $16,530 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Tha n Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At Any Distance Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ALTERNATE REALITY four wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled six wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and was up in the final jumps to the finish to score. WINTERS LION bumped at the start by SMOOTH FLYIN MIKE, chased four to five paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled six wide into upper stretch, got bumped by THUNDERIAN at the three-sixteenths as that foe came out, dug in under a drive and missed at the end. SMOOTH FLYIN MIKE broke in at the start bumping the aforementioned foe, showed the way in hand four then three wide down the backstretch before tucking to the two path through the turn, widened away at the five-sixteenths and continued just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in clear to the eighth pole, then grew leg weary inside the final seventy yards and was nailed at the end by a pair of rivals. THUNDERIAN coaxed from the gate, chased along the inside under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled four to five wide for home and came outwards bumping WINTERS LION at the three-sixteenths, ran on under a drive and was outfinished in the late going. WARRIOR RICHARD chased two to three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, offered up a mild bid but was outkicked. LIFE AND LIGHT coaxed from the start, chased along the inside under coaxing from the three-eighths, continued along the inside route into upper stretch and made no impact. Please note due to a technical and / or operator error, the teletimer photo finish was unavailable for this race and therefore the finish and all margins for the finish were provided by the chart caller.

ENTRY.NAME: Life and Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased ins, coaxed 3/8, inside 1/4, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Thunderian
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased ins, coaxed 3/8, 4-5w uppr, ran on, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Warrior Richard
ENTRY.OWNER: AB Racing LLC and Crown Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2-3w, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, mild bid, outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: Alternate Reality
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, angled 6w upper, up last jumps

ENTRY.NAME: Winters Lion
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased 4-5w, coaxed 3w 3/8, 6w upper, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Smooth Flyin Mike
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, in hand 4-3w, 2p turn, 2w 1/4p, leg weary, nailed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 5 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 83. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. INNER TURF (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: UTILIZATION RATE (FR) went to the front, was well rated while setting an uncontested pace in the two path, responded well when asked for her best in upper stretch, came under a right-handed crop nearing the furlong marker, switched to a left-handed crop while powering away coming to the sixteenth-pole and proved much the best under steady urging. DORAL stalked the pace on the outside under a snug hold in the three path, left the leader alone on the front, was asked near the quarter-pole, chased the winner under a drive into the final furlong and proved no match then just held the place. MIRABELLA bumped with a rival at the start, raced just off the pace on the inside, was asked on the far turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and just missed the place while clear for the show. EMPATHY went four wide on the first turn, was reserved on the outside, traveled around the far turn in the two path while roused and failed to rally. DOUBLE DREAM broke in and bumped with a foe, steadied briefly while in tight against the rail on the first turn, settled outside on the backstretch, was roused two then three wide on the far turn and failed to threaten. ZAPPERA rounded the opening bend in the two path, settled off the pace, was roused while saving ground on the final turn and failed to respond. TRES CHIC (ARG) broke a step slow, raced in the two path on the first turn, was reserved at the back, went around the far turn in the two path under urging, was driven three wide into the stretch and failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Mirabella
ENTRY.OWNER: Low, Lawana L. and Robert E.
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,just off pace,inside,ask2nd turn,just missed place

ENTRY.NAME: Double Dream
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in,bmpd,stdied 1st,ins,out backstretch,2-3p2nd,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Zappera
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p1st,settled,roused rail 2nd turn,no response

ENTRY.NAME: Doral
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3p1st,stalked outside,3p2nd,ask1/4,chased,no match,held2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Tres Chic (ARG)
ENTRY.OWNER: Magdalena Racing (Sherri McPeek) Lewis Tommie M and Ball James
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow,2p1st,reserved,2p2nd,3p 1/4,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Utilization Rate (FR)
ENTRY.COMMENT: to front,2p,well rated,asked 1/4,responded,drew off,steady urging

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: S.A.R.L. Neustrian Associates & Christopher Richard Hirst

ENTRY.NAME: Empathy
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w1st,reserved outside,roused 2p2nd,failed to rally

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 106. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 100000. (UP TO $17,400 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Ol der, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter Since November 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise ClaimW ill Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COLONEL BOWMAN four paths off the inside early on, tucked to the two path five furlongs out before taking to the rail into the turn, advanced inside the top pair along an open rail midway on the turn and took over command narrowly with five-sixteenths to run, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, edged clear under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in under growing threat and just lasted on the wire. VITTORIO four then three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch, closed well outside and just missed at the finish. MAJORITY PARTNER coaxed from the start, pressed the pace of HAPPY FARM from the outside five paths off the rail down the backstretch and then three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide for home, kept on to preserve the show honors. LOST IN ROME five paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked to the two path through the turn coming under coaxing half a mile from home, spun two to three wide into upper stretch and weakened. HAPPY FARM hustled from the gate, showed the way in hand three then two wide hounded by MAJORITY PARTNER to the outside, yielded the front with five-sixteenths to go, spun two to three wide into upper stretch and weakened. MARKET ALERT six paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked four wide through the turn coaxed along from the three-eighths, angled five to six wide at the head of the stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Colonel Bowman
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w early, to 2p 5/8, ins turn, up 5/16, 2w 1/4p, clear, lasted

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Farm
ENTRY.OWNER: Anthony George Roman Lawrence P Emerald Upstate Stable CT Racing Basile Stephen
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, in hand 3-2w, yielded 5/16, 2-3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Vittorio
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, 4w upper, closed well, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Lost in Rome
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5w backstretch, coaxed 2p 1/2p, 2-3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Majority Partner
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, pressed 5p, 3w turn, 3w upper, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Market Alert
ENTRY.OWNER: PlayingTheField Racing Final Turn Racing Stable LLC and Acqua Nova Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: 6w backstretch, 4w turn, coaxed 3/8, 5-6w upper, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Soaring Softly S. - Grade3 BELMONT PARK RACE 7 7F Turf CR: 96. Stakes Purse 175000. FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $175 each which should accompany the nomination; $875 to pass the entry box and an additional $875 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $875 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight: 123 lbs. Non-winners of a Graded sweepstake allowed 3 lbs.; of a sweepstake other than state-bred or two races other than maiden, claiming, starter or state bred allowan ce allowed 5 lbs. The New York Racing Association reserves the right to transfer this race to the main track. A presentation will be made to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, May 13, 2023 with 25 Nominations. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to
RACE.FOOTNOTES: QUEEN PICASSO (GB) was taken under a tight hold early, stalked the pace on the outside under snug restraint, went around the turn in the two path, was given her cue at the quarter-pole then rallied to the lead in upper stretch, fought outside of the runner-up into the final furlong and edged clear under steady urging. AMERICAN APPLE went to the front, showed the way while in hand, vied inside on the turn, was asked near the quarter-pole, lost the lead to the winner under a drive in upper stretch and was outfinished while just able to get the place. LADY BETH was rated on the inside, was roused near the five-sixteenths, came off the rail under a drive in upper stretch, pursued the top two in the final furlong and finished willingly to just miss the place while clear for the show. QUARREL stumbled two strides from the gate, was reserved at the rear, raced between foes in the two path on the turn, was roused inside the five-sixteenths and lacked the needed response. SENIOR PRANK was rated on the outside, went three wide while let out on the turn, was roused near the five-sixteenths, turned into upper stretch under a drive and also lacked the needed response.

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Beth
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside,roused turn,chased,willingly,missed 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: American Apple
ENTRY.COMMENT: to front,pace in hand,rail turn,ask1/4,headed,outfinished,held2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Queen Picasso (GB)
ENTRY.OWNER: Siena Farm LLC Kisber Michael E Deutsch Peter and The Elkstone Group LLC (Stuart
ENTRY.COMMENT: tight hold,stalked outside,2p turn,ask1/4,lead1/8,edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: Quarrel
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled after start,rated,btwn 2p turn,ask ins 5/16,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Senior Prank
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated outside,let out 3path turn,lacked needed response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 8 1M Dirt CR: 95. Claiming Purse 55000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since November 1 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At T ime Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).

CLAIM.OWNER: Two B and One C Stable

RACE.FOOTNOTES: GLORY ROAD chased three then two wide under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, angled out five to six wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command a sixteenth from home, then edged away to the finish taken back in hand in the late stages. DUST DEVIL six to seven paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked four wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung five wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command a furlong out, got collared with a sixteenth to go and ran on to preserve the place honors. PIT BOSS hustled from the gate, chased four paths off the inside down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the turn, cut the corner into upper stretch and took narrow and brief command just inside the three-sixteenths, got collared near the eighth pole and kept on to secure the show honors. ROCCO STRONG chased five wide down the backstretch and then three wide through the turn, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, continued three wide into upper stretch and weakened in the late stages. MY FRIENDS BEER coaxed from the start, showed the way in hand three then two wide, got set down spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, yielded near the three-sixteenths and weakened. DATESFREEDOM chased along the inside under coaxing from the half mile pole, continued along the inside into upper stretch and tired. BLAKE B. chased just off the inside, came under coaxing tipped four wide at the seven-sixteenths, cornered three to four wide into upper stretch and made no impact. ALCOOLS chased five to six wide under coaxing from the half mile pole, went six to seven wide into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.OWNER: Walder Peter R and Surging Sky Ventures LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand 3-2w, set down 2w 1/4p, yielded, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 9 1 3/8M Inner turf CR: 93. Allowance Purse 95000. INNER TURF (UP TO $16,530 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: INFLATION ADJUSTED went three wide on the first turn, stalked the pace on the outside, was asked in the two path on the far turn, took the lead late on that bend, kicked clear when set down into upper stretch, extended the advantage into the final furlong and proved much the best under strong urging. HOLD THE SALSA bumped with a rival at the start, bumped with the same foe early, was rated under a tight hold on the inside, dropped back with five furlongs to run, was roused while saving ground on the far turn and narrowly earned the place while no match for the winner. AFJAN broke in and bumped with a foe, bumped with that same opponent early, rounded the first turn in the two path, settled outside on the backstretch, was roused while inside on the far turn, came three wide into the stretch and just missed the place while clear for the show. FIGHTER IN THE WIN went to the front, traveled around the first turn in the two path, showed the way down the backstretch, vied inside on the far turn, was asked while being headed late on that bend and gave way. DANZIGWITHTHESTARS was fractious in the gate, went around the first turn in the two path, settled near the back, was asked in the three path on the far turn then driven four wide into the stretch and failed to rally. SWING LOW dropped back quickly while sluggish from the gate, saved ground on the turns and showed little.

ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate,2p1st,settled,urged5/8,3w2nd,4w1/4,no rally

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 10 7F Turf CR: 77. Maiden Special Weight Purse 75000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Pr eferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Seven Furlongs on the Main Track.) (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOON CRY three then two wide in pursuit, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and swung three to four wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command nearing the eighth pole, dug in under a drive holding safe to the finish kept to task. STRICTLY TABOO chased four then three wide, briefly tucked to the two path midway on the turn before coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three to four wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild kick. SNOWY EVENING chased four paths off the inside down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch and kicked on belatedly to procure the show honors. SPINNING COLORS chased two to three wide from mid pack, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild kick. PHOTON cut the pace along the inside under pressure from the get go, took the inside route into upper stretch, dug in under threat and relented just outside the eighth pole, then dug in fighting on but was outfinished in the late stages. AUTUMN pressed the pace of the aforementioned foe from the outside in the two path, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued just off the inside into upper stretch and weakened in the late going. LAKESIDE GETAWAY coaxed from the start, chased along the inside under a ride from the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and weakened. GRACEFUL ROSE saved ground in pursuit from the tail of the field, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled three to four wide into upper stretch and made no impact. THREE CUPS FULL tossed her head at the break and hit the near side stall at the start getting away last and coming under coaxing when conceding four to five lengths to the front before settling near the rear, chased just off the inside under coaxing from midway on the turn, continued in the two path into upper stretch and was unable to make an impact. BIG HAZEL chased four then three wide down the backstretch before tucking to the two path through the turn getting placed to coaxing at the three-eighths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and never menaced. GALATRONA chased along the inside bobbling a few times down the backstretch and into the turn, got placed to a protective hold and was taken in hand and altered out near the three-eighths pole through the latter portion of the turn to swing ten paths off the inside into upper stretch, got eased home under a protective hold to the finish, then walked off under her own power.

ENTRY.NAME: Galatrona
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased ins, protected and altered out 3/8, 10w uppr, eased home

ENTRY.NAME: Graceful Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved grd at rear, coaxed 3/8, angled 3-4w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Photon
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand inside under pressure, ins 1/4, collared 1/8, outfinished
